description: Two storey rear extension (following demolition of existing extension); rear basement extension; and installation of additional front and rear dormer windows.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with document/drawing references: 637.01/PL02; 637.01/PL03; Statement to Accompany a Householder Application for Development of 5 Rusthall Avenue, London, W4 1BW, prepared by Prime Meridian, dated December 2020; Construction Management Plan, dated December 2020; Application Form, prepared by Mr D Minns, dated 23.12.2020.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance and detailing of the existing building unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings listed in condition 2.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan, Policies D1 and D2 of the Draft London Plan, Policy 1.1 and 1.2 of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy and Policies 7.4 and 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To safeguard the privacy and residential amenity in accordance with Policy 7.6 of The London Plan and Policy 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | No side facing windows (north and south facing) shall be installed on the approved first-floor extension.

Reason: To safeguard the privacy and residential amenity in accordance with Policy 7.6 of The London Plan and Policy 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | Prior to the commencement of the development a detailed drainage design shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be completed in accordance with the approved detailed drainage design before the first use of the extensions, and it shall permanently be maintained as such thereafter.

Reason: To reduce flood risk in accordance with Principle 14 of the National Planning Policy Framework, Policies 5.12, 5.13 and 7.13 of The London Plan and Policies SI 12 and SI 13 of the Draft London Plan. | Prior to the first use of the approved extensions, a maintenance plan for the proposed drainage system for the lifetime of the development shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The approved plan shall be adhered to in perpetuity.

Reason: To reduce flood risk in accordance with Principle 14 of the National Planning Policy Framework, Policies 5.12, 5.13 and 7.13 of The London Plan and Policies SI 12 and SI 13 of the Draft London Plan. | Control measures during construction shall ensure that the following standards are implemented:
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays (except no work on public holidays),
- notifications of works to interested parties and neighbours
- public display of contact details, including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting, or other emissions from the site, in accordance with Policies 7.14 and 7.15 of The London Plan, Policies D14 and SI 1 of the Draft London Plan and Policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | The basement shall only be used for purposes incidental to the enjoyment of the house, and shall not be used for separate habitable accommodation, or any commercial use. Access shall only be provided through the house, as detailed in the approved drawing reference 637.01/PL02.

Reason: To ensure that the development does not detract from the amenity of the adjoining properties and to enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control over the use of the building in accordance with Policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan, Policies 1.1 and 1.2 of Ealing's Development Strategy and Policies 7.4 and 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD.
